com.hci.geotagger.activities
Class TagViewActivity

java.lang.Object
  android.app.Activity
      android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity
          android.support.v4.app.Watson
              com.actionbarsherlock.app.SherlockFragmentActivity
                  com.hci.geotagger.activities.TagViewActivity
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.actionbarsherlock.ActionBarSherlock.OnActionModeFinishedListener, com.actionbarsherlock.ActionBarSherlock.OnActionModeStartedListener, com.actionbarsherlock.ActionBarSherlock.OnCreatePanelMenuListener, com.actionbarsherlock.ActionBarSherlock.OnMenuItemSelectedListener, com.actionbarsherlock.ActionBarSherlock.OnPreparePanelListener, com.hci.geotagger.Objects.CommentViewFragment.ICommentViewCallBack, com.hci.geotagger.Objects.DescriptionViewFragment.IDescriptionViewCallback
public class TagViewActivity
extends com.actionbarsherlock.app.SherlockFragmentActivity
implements com.hci.geotagger.Objects.CommentViewFragment.ICommentViewCallBack, com.hci.geotagger.Objects.DescriptionViewFragment.IDescriptionViewCallback

This class allows user to view all information associated with a given tag. This includes comments, location data, and time stamp. This class implements sensorEventListener although it does not use its overrided methods(onAccuracyChanged and onSensorChanged) as they are not used in this iteration of geoTagger. Once the developer is sure, this implentation can be removed from this class. This class also implements ICommentViewCallBack and IDescriptionViewCallback which are used to populate the DesciptionViewFragment and CommentViewFragment after they have been resolved. Note these callbacks were deemed neccessary since we must be sure the fragments were completely instantiated and rendered before populating them with downloaded information. Therefore, we must utilize callbacks used in those fragments.

Constructor Detail

TagViewActivity

public TagViewActivity()
Method Detail

onCreate

protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
Overidded onCreate method that instantiates ui elements, downloads associated tag information, and displays them to the UI once they are finished. During new UI integration, a flag called USE_NEW_TAGVIEW_UI was used to determine if the application should be using the newer ui interface. These can be removed once it is deemed the new ui is acceptable. New UI components initialization occurs in initializeNewUIComponents method which also instantiates fragments used to display tag map, comments, and description. Many elements instantiated in this onCreate method are for the SensorEventListener which is no longer used. Therefore, these can be removed once deemed acceptable.

Overrides:
onCreate in class FragmentActivity

initializeNewUIComponents

private void initializeNewUIComponents()
InitializeComponent ported over from MobSci Interface onCreate Method to try out new UI. Principally, this method initializes Mapview, Desciptionview, and Commentview fragments asscoiated with the selected tag, as well as the fragment manager that manages them.

onResume

protected void onResume()
Overrided onResume method. Currently, sensorManager code was causing crash. DisplayTagEx must be called in this method as opposed to onCreate method to be assured that fragments are created. DisplayTagEx method populates fragments with information.

Overrides:
onResume in class FragmentActivity

onPause

protected void onPause()
SensorManager code to prevent crashes

Overrides:
onPause in class com.actionbarsherlock.app.SherlockFragmentActivity

onContextItemSelected

public boolean onContextItemSelected(android.view.MenuItem item)
Overidded OnContextItemSelected method. Changed parameter of onContextItemSelected from MenuItem to android.view.MenuItem since ActionbarSherlock has its own MenuItem class. So must use fully qualified class name. Please see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14492612/overriding-oncontextitemselected-in-actionbarsherlock
